values.description:
This adds a script to detect the major version of an ignition package by looking at its CMakeLists.txt, looking for a `set(PROJECT_MAJOR_VERSION \d` first and if that doesn't match, then it searches for `project(ignition-[a-z\-]*\d` and uses that instead. I've tested it locally on a bunch of different ignition projects, and it seems to detect the correct major version in each case.

I'm using that script to detect if ign-transport4+ is in use; so that a script compatible with ign-cmake can be used; otherwise it uses the old script.

Testing:

* [ign-transport3](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-windows7-amd64/11/console) fails but for an unrelated reason (path name is too long)
* [ign-transport4](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/534/) successful

values.description:
The ign-transport3 windows build has been failing because the pathname for some build artifacts is too long:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-windows7-amd64/7/

~~~
CMake Warning in test/integration/CMakeLists.txt:
  The object file directory

    D:/Jenkins/workspace/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-windows7-amd64/workspace/ign-transport/build/test/integration/CMakeFiles/INTEGRATION_twoProcessesSrvCallWithoutInputReplierIncreasing_aux.dir/

  has 200 characters.  The maximum full path to an object file is 250
  characters (see CMAKE_OBJECT_PATH_MAX).  Object file

    twoProcessesSrvCallWithoutInputReplierIncreasing_aux.cc.obj

  cannot be safely placed under this directory.  The build may not work
  correctly.
~~~

~~~
D:\Jenkins\workspace\ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-windows7-amd64\workspace\ign-transport\test\integration\twoProcessesSrvCallWithoutOutputReplierIncreasing_aux.cc
 : fatal error C1083: Cannot open compiler generated file:
 'CMakeFiles\INTEGRATION_twoProcessesSrvCallWithoutOutputReplierIncreasing_aux.dir\twoProcessesSrvCallWithoutOutputReplierIncreasing_aux.cc.obj':
 No such file or directory
~~~

but it's just barely too long because this test compiles on the `pr_any` and `default` jobs. The fact that the `ign-transport3` job has a longer name causes it to fail.

Since it's so close, I'm reducing the path length by renaming a local workspace folder from `workspace` to `ws`. It must be done simultaneously in multiple batch files since several of them call `project-default-devel-windows.bat`.

Testing:

* :blue_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-windows7-amd64/12/
* :blue_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/sdformat-ci-sdformat5-windows7-amd64/37/
* :yellow_heart: (one unrelated warning) https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/ignition_math-ci-ign-math3-windows7-amd64/5
* :blue_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/ignition_rndf-ci-default-windows7-amd64/44
* :yellow_heart: (expected compiler warnings) https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo8-windows7-amd64/129

values.description:
As a follow-up to pull request #504, I'm using the python version detection script more widely, in the Linux jobs in this pull request and for homebrew in the next one. In addition, I made the following changes:

1. script is renamed from `detect_ignition_major_version.py` to `detect_cmake_major_version.py` and add support for gazebo and sdformat versions

1. add `_` to ignition regex to support `ignition-fuel_tools0` project name

Test builds:

* :blue_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-windows7-amd64/13

* :blue_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/BuildCopFail/job/ignition_transport-ci-default-xenial-amd64/55

values.description:
Without this I ran into the following issue over the weekend https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/ariac-debbuilder/77/console :

```
Step 20/29 : RUN locale-gen en_GB.utf8
 ---> Running in 7d6ec42398ce
/bin/sh: 1: locale-gen: not found
The command '/bin/sh -c locale-gen en_GB.utf8' returned a non-zero code: 127
```

Think the ubuntu base images removed this [nearly a year ago](https://github.com/docker-library/official-images/issues/2856), but I saw there has been some docker cache cleaning work recently that probably caused this to pop up only recently.

As a note, I [originally had](#!/osrf/release-tools/commits/b31dd11077dbc40eae88411b6d993bd8a0f38849) `rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*`, but it caused the following error (https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/ariac-debbuilder/80/consoleFull#-10857956996e2e1b04-6601-495c-8fb8-66d94e1f3e63):

```
  Removing ariac2-build-deps:amd64 because I can't find libgazebo8-dev:amd64
```

Without this I ran into the following issue over the weekend https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/ariac-debbuilder/77/console :

Step 20/29 : RUN locale-gen en_GB.utf8
 ---> Running in 7d6ec42398ce
/bin/sh: 1: locale-gen: not found
The command '/bin/sh -c locale-gen en_GB.utf8' returned a non-zero code: 127

Think the ubuntu base images removed this nearly a year ago, but I saw there has been some docker cache cleaning work recently that probably caused this to pop up only recently.

As a note, I originally had rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*, but it caused the following error (https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/ariac-debbuilder/80/consoleFull#-10857956996e2e1b04-6601-495c-8fb8-66d94e1f3e63):

values.description:
* 3c1d529: the brew ruby command is built-in now, so we don't need to tap homebrew/dev-tools

* b48723d: restore `HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG` (revert pull request #538) since brew 1.5.6 has been released

* ee72b4a: homebrew will auto-update before executing certain commands, but this can cause formulae to be out of sync. For example, [this build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1416/console) failed the `brew doctor` call after `make install`:

~~~
++ brew doctor
Please note that these warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers
with debugging if you file an issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is
working fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this. Thanks!

Warning: Some installed formulae are missing dependencies.
You should `brew install` the missing dependencies:
  brew install octomap

Run `brew missing` for more details.
~~~

The build script first called `brew install gazebo10 --only-dependencies`, then `brew install python` in order to install an extra pip package. Installing python caused the `fcl` formula to update, which just so happened to include a [new dependency](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/24684):

~~~
++ brew install python
Updating Homebrew...
==> Auto-updated Homebrew!
Updated 1 tap (homebrew/core).
==> Updated Formulae
fcl

Warning: python 2.7.14_3 is already installed
~~~

This is a pretty rare failure mode, but it is preventable if we don't allow homebrew auto-updates.
values.title: homebrew updates: remove old tap, no auto-update

Please note that these warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers

==> Updated Formulae
fcl

Warning: python 2.7.14_3 is already installed

This is a pretty rare failure mode, but it is preventable if we don't allow homebrew auto-updates.

values.description:
optimus was low on disk space today, but the fix in pull request #533 wasn't working because `docker ps -q` was empty. adding `|| true` lets these commands proceed.

~~~
+++ echo 'Space left is low again: 91% used'
Space left is low again: 91% used
+++ echo 'Kill the whole docker cache !!'
Kill the whole docker cache !!
++++ sudo docker ps -q
+++ sudo docker kill
"docker kill" requires at least 1 argument.
See 'docker kill --help'.

Usage:  docker kill [OPTIONS] CONTAINER [CONTAINER...] [flags]

Kill one or more running containers
Build step 'Execute shell' marked build as failure
~~~

* example failure: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64/68/console
* test build that removed everything: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_math4-install-pkg-xenial-amd64/66/consoleFull

values.description:
The homebrew `python` package now refers to python3. Thus it no longer has the `pip2` command, so some gazebo builds are failing:

~~~
++ brew install python
Warning: python 3.6.4_3 is already installed
++ export PYTHONPATH=/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages:
++ PYTHONPATH=/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages:
++ pip2 install lxml
./scripts/jenkins-scripts/lib/project-default-devel-homebrew-amd64.bash: line 77:
 pip2: command not found
~~~

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1422/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1423/

So switch back to the unversioned version of pip, which is now available again. Also, update `flaky_junit_merge.py` to support python3. Also update the cleanup script to remove python site-packages for all versions.

Test build:

:red_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1424

:red_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1425/

:yellow_heart: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1426/ but all the gui tests are marked as failures due to a python3 issue

:grey_question: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1428/ I aborted it early, but the gui tests are working again with a special branch of gazebo

:blue_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/sdformat-ci-sdformat5-homebrew-amd64/32

:blue_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/sdformat-ci-sdformat4-homebrew-amd64/61

:red_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-homebrew-amd64/8/

:yellow_heart: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-homebrew-amd64/9/

found another python3 issue in the failed gazebo build (fixed in abc3583), and I found an issue with protobuf (reported upstream [here](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/24815))

values.description:
We updated for python3 compatibility in pull request #541, but this was reverted in upstream homebrew in order to maintain compatibility with PEP 394. The python@2 formula is now the one that installs the `python` symlink to `/usr/local/bin`, so we can continue using that. Also, a bug in the protobuf formula has been fixed, so we can remove some code from pull request #541.

Finally, we can use homebrew tags again since a new release has been made.

Test builds:

values.description:
I chatted with @chapulina and she made me think about how the buildcop_stats script could do more to generate the buildcop report. I've updated it to give links with build status badges for the failing tests. It doesn't include the annotation that we usually add about which builds have always failed vs. those that only started failing recently, but it's a start.

An example of what this script generates:

https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/wiki/buildcop/2018/03/12.md
values.title: extend buildcop_stats script to list failing builds

I think that this came from the times of gazebo failing to build on Windows due to internal compiler errors. It was really not working and retrying all the failing jobs.

I tested it in sdformat: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/\_dsl\_sdformat/544/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/_dsl_sdformat/544/)
